title: The Canons of Dort: A study guide
author: Henry Petersen
description: A study guide for the Canons of Dort

title: A New English Translation of the Canons of Dort
author: Anthony A. Hoekema
description: A new English translation of the Canons of Dort by Anthony A. Hoekema

title: Saving the Reformation: The Pastoral Theology of the Canons of Dort
author: W. Robert Godfrey
description: Dr. Godfrey takes readers back to 1618-19 when the Canons of Dort were written, offering a new translation and pastoral commentary for the 400th anniversary

title: The three forms of unity Heidelberg catechism Belgic confession Canons of Dort 1900
author: Anonymous
description: Leather bound edition of the Three Forms of Unity including the Canons of Dort

title: The Canons of Dort: The Decision of the Synod of Dordt on the Five Main Points of Doctrine in Dispute in the Netherlands
author: Anonymous
description: The decision of the Synod of Dordt on the Five Main Points of Doctrine

title: The Canons of Dort & TULIP
author: JJ Lim
description: An introduction to the Canons of Dort and the TULIP acronym

title: The Canons of Dort: God's Freedom, Justice, and Persistence
author: Eugene P. Heideman, Donald J. Bruggink
description: A study of the Canons of Dort focusing on God's freedom, justice, and persistence

title: The Glory of Grace: the Story of the Canons of Dort
author: William Boekestein, Evan Hughes (Illustrator)
description: A children's book about the story of the Canons of Dort, illustrated by Evan Hughes

title: But for the Grace of God: An Exposition of the Canons of Dort
author: Cornelis P. Venema
description: A comprehensive exposition of the Canons of Dort by Cornelis P. Venema

title: The Three Forms of Unity
author: Synod of Dort
description: Includes the Belgic Confession, the Heidelberg Catechism, and the Canons of Dort. Published March 13, 2024

title: The articles of the Synod of Dort
author: Thomas Scott
description: Historical presentation of the articles of the Synod of Dort

title: The Synod of Dort: Historical, Theological, and Experiential Perspectives
author: Joel R. Beeke, Martin I. Klauber (Editors)
description: Published for the 400th anniversary, includes contributions from leading scholars of post-Reformation Reformed thought

title: Tulip: The Five Points of Calvinism in the Light of Scripture
author: Duane Edward Spencer, Luder G. Whitlock Jr.
description: The five points of Calvinism explained in light of Scripture, with nearly 55,000 copies in print since 1979

title: T.U.L.I.P.: The Five Disputed Points of Calvinism
author: Ben Lacy Rose
description: Clear language examination of the five disputed points of Calvinism

title: Five Points of Calvinism, The
author: Edwin H. Palmer
description: Using the classic TULIP acronym, this primer on the five points of Calvinism is perfect for students and laypeople

title: Unspeakable Comfort: A Commentary on the Canons of Dort
author: Peter G. Feenstra
description: A commentary on the Canons of Dort with 210 pages, bibliography and numerous questions for discussion and study

title: Grace and Assurance: The Message of the Canons of Dordt
author: Martyn McGeown
description: An accessible commentary on the Canons leading readers through the comforting message of salvation by God's grace

title: Revisiting the Synod of Dordt 1618-1619
author: Aza Goudriaan, Fred Van Lieburg (Editors)
description: Collected volume presenting new facts and analyses concerning the Synod, its context, and its legacy

title: The Synod of Dordt (1618–1619) and the Canons: Historical Perspectives
author: Donald Sinnema, Erik A. de Boer
description: Features essays by Donald Sinnema and Erik de Boer on historical perspectives of the Synod of Dort

title: Early Sessions of the Synod of Dordt (Acta Et Documenta Synodi Nationalis Dordrechtanae (1618-1619)
author: Donald Sinnema, Christian Moser, Herman J. Selderhuis, Johanna Roelevink, Dagmar Bronner
description: Documents relating to the early sessions until the expulsion of the Remonstrants, many published for the first time

title: The Convening of the Synod of Dordt (Acta Et Documenta Synodi Nationalis Dordrechtanae (1618-1619)
author: Donald Sinnema, Christian Moser, Erik A. de Boer, Herman J. Selderhuis, Johanna Roelevink
description: Documents on the convening of the Synod of Dort

title: Acta of the Synod of Dordt (Acta Et Documenta Synodi Nationalis Dordrechtanae (1618-1619)
author: Christian Moser, Herman Selderhuis, Donald Sinnema
description: Includes the original Acta Authentica published for the first time alongside the published Acta

title: A Landmark in Turbulent Times: The Meaning and Relevance of the Synod of Dordt (1618-1619)
author: Henk Van Den Belt, Klaas-Willem de Jong, Willem van Vlastuin
description: Academic study on the meaning and relevance of the Synod of Dordt

title: The Three Forms of Unity: Belgic Confession of Faith, Heidelberg Catechism & Canons of Dort
author: Joel Beeke (Editor)
description: Edited and introduced by Dr. Joel Beeke, includes Scripture Index and the Apostles', Nicene, and Athanasian Creeds

title: The Three Forms of Unity: The Heidelberg Cathechism, Modern English Version, the Belgic Confession of Faith & The Canons of Dort
author: Synod of Dort, Reformed Church in the United States
publisher: Reformed Church in the United States
description: Modern English Version with Harmony of the Three Forms of Unity, uses NKJV for Scripture quotes

title: The Three Forms of Unity: Heidelberg Catechism, Belgic Confession, Canons of Dort (Classic Reprint)
author: Protestant Reformed Church
description: Reproduction of an early 20th-century document containing the three core Reformed confessional documents

title: The deeper faith: An exposition of the Canons of the Synod of Dort
author: Gordon H. Girod
description: An exposition of the Canons of the Synod of Dort

title: The Crisis of Calvinism in Revolutionary England, 1640-1660: Arminian Theologies of Predestination and Grace
author: Dr Andrew Ollerton
description: Examines Arminian theologies in the context of Western theological tradition and soteriological debates following the Synod of Dort

title: CALVINISM VS. ARMINIANISM: The Bible Answers
author: Edward D. Andrews
description: Examines the Calvinism-Arminianism debate and how they interpret key biblical passages

title: The great debate: Calvinism, Arminianism, and salvation
author: Alan P. F. Sell
description: Part of Studies in Christian thought and history series examining the Calvinist-Arminian debate

title: A Faith Worth Defending: The Synod of Dort's Enduring Heritage
author: Jon D. Payne & Sebastian Heck (Editors)
description: Contributors include Michael Horton, W. Robert Godfrey, Jon D. Payne, Sebastian Heck, Christopher Gordon, Lyle Bierma, Kevin J. Bidwell, Joel Beeke, Daniel R. Hyde, Cornelis Venema, and J.V. Fesko

title: A Place Like Heaven: An Introduction to the Synod of Dort
author: Samuel Miller
description: Miller concisely and compellingly defends the Calvinism of Dort against its detractors

title: The History and Theology of Calvinism
author: Curt Daniel
description: Comprehensive overview of Calvinism covering history of Reformed theologians and preachers, and theology of God's sovereignty and five points

title: Five Points Of Calvinism
author: W. J. Seaton
description: Banner of Truth publication covering Total depravity, Unconditional election, Limited atonement, Irresistible grace, and Perseverance of the saints

title: Evangelistic Calvinism
author: J. Benton
description: Focuses on how TULIP provides a framework for sharing the gospel

title: The Practical Implications of Calvinism
author: Albert N. Martin
description: Presents Calvinism as involving a sight of the majesty of God

title: Ten Myths About Calvinism: Recovering the Breadth of the Reformed Tradition
author: Kenneth J. Stewart
description: Identifies ten myths about Calvinism, discusses the Canons of Dort and TULIP's historical development

title: For Calvinism
author: Michael Horton
description: Explores historical roots of Reformed thought and delivers the essence of Calvinism, examining election, atonement, and effectual calling

title: The Reformed Doctrine of Predestination
author: Loraine Boettner
description: Covers God's sovereignty, Five Points of Calvinism, salvation by grace, and Calvinism in history. In print for over 75 years

title: Reformed dogmatics
author: Herman Hoeksema
description: Systematic theology by one who spent 40 years in the Chair of Dogmatics at Protestant Reformed Seminary. Faithful to Reformed creeds including Canons of Dort

title: What Are Election and Predestination? (Basics of the Reformed Faith)
author: Richard D. Phillips
description: Excellent defense of the doctrine of election and predestination from Reformed perspective

title: The Sovereignty of God
author: Arthur W. Pink
description: Classic work on God's sovereignty originally published in 1918, defending sovereignty in creation, administration, salvation, and reprobation

title: Grace Worth Fighting For: Recapturing the Vision of God's Grace in the Canons of Dort
author: Daniel R. Hyde
description: 400th anniversary celebration leading readers through history and text of the Canons, illuminating theological distinctions and scriptural truths

title: Spurgeon vs. Hyper-Calvinism: The Battle for Gospel Preaching
author: Iain H. Murray
description: Examines C.H. Spurgeon's doctrinal controversy with Hyper-Calvinism, showing the battle for evangelical truth

title: Debating Calvinism: Five Points, Two Views
author: Dave Hunt, James White
description: James White takes the Calvinist position while Dave Hunt opposes, debating the Five Points

title: The Potter's Freedom: A Defense of the Reformation and a Rebuttal To Norman Geisler's Chosen But Free
author: James White, R. C. Sproul Jr.
description: Full-length response defending Calvinism, covering Total Depravity, Unconditional Election, Particular Redemption, and Irresistible Grace

title: Reforming Free Will: A Conversation on the History of Reformed Views on Compatibilism (1500-1800)
author: Paul Helm
description: Examines reformed orthodox views of free will and divine sovereignty, considering determinism and compatibilism 1500-1800

title: The Providence of God (Contours of Christian Theology)
author: Paul Helm
description: Focuses on divine control, providence and evil, and the role of prayer in Reformed theology

title: Post-Reformation Reformed Dogmatics: The Rise and Development of Reformed Orthodoxy, ca. 1520 to ca. 1725 (4 vols.)
author: Richard A. Muller
description: Comprehensive examination of how 16th-17th century doctrines developed. Covers prolegomena, Scripture, divine essence & attributes, and Trinity

title: Reformed Dogmatics (Single Volume Edition): A System of Christian Theology
author: Geerhardus Vos, Richard B. Gaffin (Editor)
description: Early theological thought of premier Reformed thinker covering ecclesiology, means of grace, and eschatology

title: The Doctrine of the Covenant in Reformed Theology
author: Geerhardus Vos
description: Brief essay detailing historical development of covenant theology and the Reformed view of the covenant of grace

title: Systematic Theology
author: Louis Berkhof
description: Most important 20th century compendium of Reformed Theology, published 1932, revised 1938

title: Summary of Christian Doctrine
author: Louis Berkhof
description: Condensed summary of Berkhof's systematic theology

title: Twelve Sermons on Election
author: Charles Spurgeon
description: Collection of Spurgeon's sermons on Divine Sovereignty, Free Grace, Election, and Particular Election

title: Spurgeon and the Doctrines of Grace: Sermons on Calvinism and Its Practical Application
author: Charles H. Spurgeon
description: Spurgeon's sermons on Calvinism and practical application of Reformed doctrine

title: In Defense of Calvinism: With Select Sermons on the Doctrines of Grace
author: Charles Spurgeon
description: Spurgeon's defense of Calvinism with select sermons on the doctrines of grace

title: Defense of Calvinism
author: C. H. Spurgeon
description: Spurgeon defends total depravity, election, limited atonement, and perseverance

title: Chosen by God
author: R. C. Sproul
description: Contemporary classic on predestination with nearly 200,000 copies sold. Explains five points of Calvinism (TULIP)

title: What is Reformed Theology?: Understanding the Basics
author: R. C. Sproul
description: Introduction to the basics of Reformed theology

title: Five Points: Towards a Deeper Experience of God's Grace
author: John Piper
description: Conversational exploration of five points of Calvinism with warm pastoral sensitivity covering TULIP

title: The Five Points of Calvinism: Defined, Defended, Documented
author: David N. Steele, Curtis C. Thomas, S. Lance Quinn
description: Updated edition with ESV Scripture, classic introduction to essential tenets of Calvinistic theology with expanded content

title: Evangelism and the Sovereignty of God
author: J. I. Packer, Mark Dever
description: Shows how right understanding of God's sovereignty is support for evangelism. Over 100,000 copies in print

title: Knowing God
author: J. I. Packer, Kevin J. Vanhoozer
description: Classic book on God's sovereignty. Named one of top 50 books that shaped evangelicals by Christianity Today

title: Institutes of Elenctic Theology (3 Volume Set)
author: Francis Turretin, James T. Dennison Jr. (Editor), George Musgrave Giger (Translator)
description: First published 1679-85, fruit of 30 years teaching at Geneva. Contrasts Reformed theology with Catholic, Arminian, and Socinian views

title: Reformed Dogmatics (4 Volume Set)
author: Herman Bavinck, John Bolt (Editor), John Vriend (Translator)
description: Complete Reformed Dogmatics from Dutch Reformed Translation Society. Famous for 'grace restores and perfects nature' theme

title: Reformed Dogmatics: Abridged in One Volume
author: Herman Bavinck, John Bolt (Editor)
description: One-volume abridgment offering accessible summary of 4-volume Reformed Dogmatics for students and pastors

title: ESV Reformation Study Bible
author: R.C. Sproul (General Editor)
description: Over 1.1 million words of commentary from 75 theologians/pastors from Calvinistic/Reformed perspective

title: The Works of John Owen, D. D, Vol. 6: Containing the Doctrine of the Saints' Perseverance Explained and Confirmed
author: John Owen
description: Most masterly vindication of perseverance of the saints in English, written to answer Arminian John Goodwin. 553 pages

title: Lectures on Calvinism (Stone Lectures of 1898)
author: Abraham Kuyper
description: Six Stone Lectures delivered at Princeton 1898 covering Calvinism as life system, and in relation to religion, politics, science, art, and future

title: The Plan of Salvation
author: B. B. Warfield
description: Five lectures from 1914 analyzing all possible soteriologies, concluding salvation is from God (Particularism/Calvinism)

title: Still Sovereign: Contemporary Perspectives on Election, Foreknowledge, and Grace
author: Thomas R. Schreiner, Bruce A. Ware (Editors)
description: 13 scholars defend classical view of God's sovereignty. Contributors include D.A. Carson, J.I. Packer, John Piper, Wayne Grudem

title: Chosen for Life: The Case for Divine Election
author: Sam Storms
description: Well-reasoned case for divine election examining Romans 9 and NT, freedom of will, and order of salvation

title: Simply Trinity: The Unmanipulated Father, Son, and Spirit
author: Matthew Barrett, Scott R. Swain (Foreword)
description: Christianity Today Book of Year. Reveals manipulated Trinity in modern theology, rediscovering classical Trinitarian doctrine

title: Reformation Theology: A Systematic Summary
author: Matthew Barrett (Editor), Michael Horton, Michael Allen, Gerald Bray, Graham A. Cole
description: Systematic summary of Reformation theology from Reformed perspective

title: Compel Them to Come In: Calvinism and the Free Offer of the Gospel
author: Donald Macleod
description: Sets the free offer of gospel in widest context of God's purpose and Christ's work within Reformed theology

title: From the Marrow Men to the Moderates: Scottish Theology 1700–1800
author: Donald Macleod
description: Guide through major characters and theological discussions of 18th century Scottish theology

title: Therefore the Truth I Speak: Scottish Theology 1500 – 1700
author: Donald Macleod
description: Examines leading Reformed theologians of Scotland in 16th-17th centuries making doctrine conform to Scripture

title: The Presbyterian Philosopher: The Authorized Biography of Gordon H. Clark
author: Doug J. Douma, Lois Zeller, Betsy Clark George
description: Biography of Gordon Clark (1902-85), respected philosopher and writer on Reformed theology and predestination

title: Grace Defined and Defended: What a 400-Year-Old Confession Teaches Us about Sin, Salvation, and the Sovereignty of God
author: Kevin DeYoung
description: Brief, accessible commentary on background and theology of Canons of Dort, focusing on beauty and power of God's saving grace

title: The History and Theology of Calvinism
author: Curt Daniel
description: 74 chapters, 900+ pages. Surveys Reformed theologians/preachers and discusses doctrines of God's sovereignty and five points

title: The Doctrines of Grace: Rediscovering the Evangelical Gospel
author: James Montgomery Boice, Philip Graham Ryken, R. C. Sproul
description: Covers radical depravity, unconditional election, particular redemption, efficacious grace and persevering grace with historical context

title: The Commentary of Dr. Zacharias Ursinus on the Heidelberg Catechism
author: Zacharias Ursinus, G. W. Willard (Translator)
description: Commentary by primary author of Heidelberg Catechism, one of Three Forms of Unity alongside Canons of Dort

title: The Heidelberg Catechism
author: Zacharias Ursinus, Caspar Olevianus
description: Protestant confessional document from 1563, one of Three Forms of Unity with Canons of Dort

title: The Belgic Confession: Truth Worth Dying For
author: Guido de Bres, Jonathan L. Shirk
description: Belgic Confession by Guido de Bres with brief history. One of Three Forms of Unity adopted at Synod of Dort 1618-1619

title: Systematic Theology: An Introduction to Christian Belief
author: John M. Frame, J.I. Packer (Foreword)
description: Systematic theology from traditional Calvinist perspective in Westminster tradition by RTS professor

title: No Place for Sovereignty: What's Wrong with Freewill Theism
author: R.K. McGregor Wright
description: Makes case for Reformed emphasis on God's sovereign grace, addresses Arminianism and open view of God

title: Pilgrim Theology: Core Doctrines for Christian Disciples
author: Michael Horton
description: Accessible companion to Christian Faith systematic theology, guiding readers through Christian theology in Reformed key

title: The Westminster Confession of Faith and Catechisms As Adopted By the Presbyterian Church in America
author: The Orthodox Presbyterian Church
description: Westminster Standards with proof texts, official PCA version of Reformed confessional documents

title: The Westminster Confession: the Confession of Faith, the Larger and Shorter Catechism
author: Westminster Divines
description: Complete Westminster Standards including Sum of Saving Knowledge, Directory for Public Worship, and associated historical documents

title: Caspar Olevian and the Substance of the Covenant
author: R. Scott Clark
description: Places Olevian's thought in historical context, examines relationship to Heidelberg Catechism and wider Reformed world

title: German Calvinism in the Confessional Age: The Covenant Theology of Caspar Olevianus
author: Lyle D. Bierma
description: Detailed study of Olevianus's doctrine of covenant and its place in 16th-century Reformed covenant thought

title: An Exposition of the Apostles' Creed - Classic Reformed Theology Series
author: Casper Olevianus
description: Explains Christian faith as believer's fellowship with God in covenant of grace by co-author of Heidelberg Catechism

title: Standing Forth: Collected Writings of Roger Nicole
author: Roger Nicole
description: Collection of important essays on doctrine of God, five points of Calvinism, Scripture and Atonement by pre-eminent Reformed theologian

title: The Reformers and Their Stepchildren
author: Leonard Verduin, Franklin H. Littell
description: Focuses on relationship between Magisterial Reformers and Radical Reformers, tracing history of reformed thought

title: Saved by Grace
author: Anthony A. Hoekema
description: Modern classic in soteriology from Reformed perspective covering gospel call, regeneration, conversion, justification, sanctification, perseverance

title: Created in God's Image
author: Anthony A. Hoekema
description: Part of trilogy of Reformed theology studies by Hoekema on Christian anthropology
